news.title: Ludhiana: F&CC clears key works, cost rise in C&D plant sparks questions
news.para: Ludhiana's Finance and Contracts Committee approved 115 resolutions, including the redevelopment of major chowks under the National Clean Air Programme. The cost of the construction and demolition waste plant also increased to Rs 8.46 crore due to boundary wall expansion and revised piling methods. Concerns were raised regarding a central verge construction project.

news.title: Railway gets ₹1,368-crore bid for nearly six-acre land parcel in central Mumbai
news.para: Dineshchandra R Agrawal Infracon is the only bidder for the land parcel to be redeveloped on a revenue share model through a long-term lease agreement. The reserve price for the plot, which will be allotted through a 99-year lease, was Rs 1,343 crore.

news.title: One accused, over 100 victims and ₹2 crore PMAY fraud in Ahmedabad
news.para: A man, Neel Madhav Patel, is accused of duping over 100 women of more than Rs 2 crore. He allegedly promised them houses under the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana without any formal process. Victims paid large sums for direct allotments and upgrades. When questioned, Patel issued bounced cheques.

news.title: Kolkata civic body launches city-wide drive to demolish dilapidated, insecure buildings
news.para: Following a building collapse, the Kolkata Municipal Corporation is launching a city-wide demolition drive for dilapidated and insecure structures. The KMC Buildings Department will use special powers to raze buildings posing a threat to residents and pedestrians, with over 150 identified for immediate action. The civic body is also offering incentives for reconstruction to accommodate existing tenants.

news.title: RBI urges NBFCs, HFCs to maintain sound underwriting standards, close monitoring of asset quality
news.para: Reserve Bank Governor Sanjay Malhotra convened with executives from prominent Non-Banking Financial Companies. He emphasized the necessity for robust underwriting practices and meticulous asset quality evaluations. The Governor also underscored the importance of prioritizing customer needs and embracing responsible lending practices.

news.title: Karnataka government relaxes setback norms for small plots in Bengaluru
news.para: Bengaluru's government has eased building regulations for small residential plots, amending the master plan to relax setback rules for properties up to 4,000 square meters. New norms offer reduced front and side setbacks, and eliminate rear setbacks for plots as small as 60sqm, unlocking buildable space while ensuring safety and rainwater percolation.

news.title: More FAR in Bengaluru will worsen civic woes: Supreme Court
news.para: The Supreme Court questioned Karnataka's decision to allow Premium Floor Area Ratio (PFAR) for construction, fearing it will lead to multistoried buildings on narrow Bengaluru roads. Justices expressed concern over strained civic amenities and congestion, urging the state to prioritize residents' interests over builders'.

news.title: Mumbai: FIR filed against Aiko Builders' director in ₹30 crore cheating case
news.para: Mumbai builder Neeraj Vora faces cheating charges for allegedly defrauding a businessman of Rs 30 crore in a Mira Road real estate deal. Vora promised land development and substantial returns but failed to deliver, instead transferring the land to others. Police are investigating the transactions and Vora's role.

news.title: Minto Apartment REIT to be taken private by Crestpoint in $2.3 billion deal
news.para: An affiliate of Crestpoint Real Estate Investments, in collaboration with the Minto Group, is poised to take over Minto Apartment Real Estate Investment Trust in a compelling all-cash deal worth about $2.3 billion.

news.title: SC asks Uttarakhand govt to file report disclosing illegal constructions on forest land
news.para: The Supreme Court has raised alarms regarding rampant illegal encroachments on forest land in Uttarakhand. The court pointed to alarming inaction from state officials, hinting at a troubling potential partnership with the land usurpers. It has mandated the Uttarakhand government to prepare a detailed report on all unauthorized constructions within forest territories.

news.title: Thane locals cry foul over ready-mix concrete plant
news.para: Residents allege illegal night-time ops at RMC plant near Haware City, cite hazardous pollution levels and official inaction despite a pending PIL

news.title: Jaipur: LSG department to ask owners for demolition costs of 20 buildings in Chomu
news.para: Authorities in Chomu town are preparing to send recovery notices to owners of 20 buildings demolished following alleged stone-pelting incidents against police. This marks the first large-scale demolition by the local civic body, which also sealed three other structures for construction without proper documentation. The move aims to recover demolition costs from the property owners.

news.title: Sundaram Alternates targets ₹2,000 crore for real estate credit fund V by March 2026
news.para: Sundaram Alternates aims for ₹1,500–2,000 crore for its new real estate credit fund. The fund has already attracted over ₹1,000 crore.  This is the fifth fund in their real estate credit series.

news.title: Chimbel villagers harden stance against Unity Mall, to continue protest till govt scraps project
news.para: Chimbel villagers are intensifying their agitation against the Unity Mall and Prashaasan Stambh projects, vowing to continue their hunger strike until the government scraps them. Political leaders and activists have voiced strong opposition, alleging corruption and environmental degradation, and urging the public to resist the projects.

news.title: Runwal Enterprises acquires 200 acres in Alibaug for ₹20,000-crore township
news.para: Runwal Enterprises is developing a massive Rs 20,000 crore township in Alibaug. The 200-acre project will feature residential and commercial spaces, a five-star hotel, and a golf course. This large-scale development, planned over seven years, highlights Alibaug's growing appeal as a prime destination. The company is investing Rs 9,000 crore in this ambitious venture.

news.title: Sand miners found digging Yamuna riverbed in Sector 126, Noida for minerals
news.para: Illegal sand mining was found along the Yamuna riverbed in Noida's Raipur Khadar village. Authorities imposed a Rs 5 lakh penalty on the leaseholder and registered an FIR. This action followed a field inspection revealing unauthorized extraction of minor minerals. The leaseholder had permissions for sand mining since 2021.

news.title: India office market posts net absorption of 61 million sq ft in 2025: Report
news.para: In 2025, India's office sector soared to new heights with an unprecedented net absorption of 61.4 million sq ft. Bengaluru took the lead in demand, closely trailed by the dynamic Delhi NCR. The surge was largely fueled by Global Capability Centres, highlighting their pivotal role in this flourishing market.

news.title: It's Dubai calling for flexible office providers, fund houses
news.para: Indian businesses are increasingly choosing Dubai for expansion. Flexible workspace provider CorporatEdge and fund house Nisus Finance Services Company Limited have made significant investments. Dubai's investor-friendly policies, tax-free environment, and Golden Visa program make it attractive. This offers Indian companies a compelling alternative for global growth and investment.

news.title: Five sub-registrars suspended after 1,332 illegal property registrations in Bengaluru
news.para: A major property registration scam has been uncovered in Bengaluru, leading to the suspension of five sub-registrars. Over 1,300 properties were allegedly registered fraudulently using the e-khata system by bypassing mandatory e-khata details from the e-swathu software. The investigation was triggered by a complaint from the Centre for Smart Governance.

news.title: Kerala’s policy reversal set to legitimise land-use violations
news.para: Land-use violations in Idukki, previously pursued with public resources and legal action, are now at risk of retrospective legitimization under a new policy.  These widespread breaches, involving resorts, commercial establishments, and party offices on government and restricted lands, could be nullified, undermining years of enforcement efforts.
